title: Ticket #5860: Clarify that MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH is mounted after PreCmd finishes
description:
From the RUST ticket:

In light of my recent tinkering with using compiled MATLAB as a PreCmd and its use of /tmp for a MATLAB Compiler Runtime cache directory by default, I'd suggest that the manual be updated to clarify in section 3.3.9 that the MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH mounts do not take place until the PreCmd has finished running. In the MATLAB case, the PreCmd failed because of permission issues in the /tmp path to the cache, which surprised me since I was expecting it to use the $(EXECUTE)/tmp directory.

Also, since it is described as a ClassAd expression evaluated in the job context:

MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH = ifThenElse(TARGET.UtsnameSysname ? "Linux", "/tmp,/var/tmp", "")

... an example to that effect would be great!

And finally, it'd be good to point out in the documentation that it cannot be set to UNDEFINED, since otherwise the starter will choke out since it expects it to be a String type. Or, perhaps modify the starter code to accept UNDEFINED as equivalent to an empty string:

08/22/16 15:57:22 (pid:187148) ERROR: MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH does not evaluate to a string, it is : undefined
